basics.name: Nicholas Moore
basics.label: Cloud Systems Architect
basics.summary: Nick hails from Pensacola, Florida. He has earned a degree in Information Technology from the University of West Florida.

work.summary: Support the design, implementation, and on-going maintenance of our Cloud Solutions.
highlights: Work with stakeholders to drive scope definition, specifications, and architecture of Deployment Tools & Processes for Guidewire Cloud
Work closely with engineers, test engineers, product owners and management to understand requirements, define and implement best practices and standards around DevOps and Service Availability
Develop new CI/CD build chains using Teamcity & Atlassian Jira
Create customized Cloudhealth reports to track InsuranceNow spend and identify any budgetary issues
Perform monthly reviews of Cloudhealth reports to identify services which may need right sizing or candidates for optimizations
Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation monitoring systems for meeting defined SLAs

work.summary: Support the design, implementation, and on-going maintenance of our Cloud Solutions.
highlights: Architect and Design the next generation Guidewire Cloud for InsuranceNow utilizing AWS EKS, Terraform & Teamcity
Investigate, troubleshoot and resolve any issues that impact the customer's ability to successfully execute CI/CD build chains
Hands-on build and manage customer development and performance-testing environments in the cloud
Measurement, optimization, and tuning of system performance and ensuring that systems will run reliably and are highly available in a 24/7 production environment
Define, implement and document operational processes and procedures, with periodic review for efficiency and improvement
Manage complex projects from inception to completion
Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation monitoring systems for meeting defined SLAs

work.summary: Provide architectural & technical guidance on AWS Cloud & On Premises environments for enterprise.
highlights: Created Livingston International's AWS cloud footprint growing to >20 accounts across 4 regions.
Architected the Tradesphere Next Generation full CI/CD workflow with Jenkins, CodeCommit, CodePipeline & CodeBuild.
Multi-AZ VPC, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, DMVPN Backup to on-prem.
SSO Federation with PingFederate & IAM Roles
ECS on EC2 & Fargate
CloudFormation template design
Deployed 6x Cisco UCS Failure Domains with 2 Chassis each
HPE Nimble HF & AF SAN
Cisco MDS 9000 storage fabric
Re-designed the corporate Oracle footprint in AWS with RDS & EC2 where necessary
Re-designed the enterprise financial accounting Oracle database in AWS on EC2 with GP2 backed ASM striped storage.
Re-designed the enterprise BigData Cloudera Hadoop infrastructure & integrated Kerberos interaction with Active Directory
Migrated & Decommissioned 6+ disparate data centers into DC3 & TR2 on Cisco UCS
Deployed a Zabbix monitoring environment with 2000+ hosts and proxies at edge locations
Worked with gathering requirements from several product development teams and architected a robust, highly available platforms for which product lines would be hosted and accessed by customers.

work.summary: Design & Architect a converged VMWare ESXi environment to replace the legacy single server hypervisors in an effort to reduce costs and improve reliability.
highlights: Designed new clustered virtualization infrastructure to eliminate single points of failure.
Completed cloud feasibility study with multiple cloud and IAAS vendors to determine if it made financial sense to migrate from on premise equipment into the cloud.
Designed new Active Directory implementation to replace aging and misconfigured Active Directory
Implemented disaster recovery plan and automation with HIDâ€™s two largest products.
Implemented an external node classifier (theforeman) to automate the PXE booting of VMware guest machines, physical servers and AWS EC2 Instances.

work.summary: Provide support to the needs and requirements of the Global Systems group at TNSI. Contributed a new method of Systems Administration at TNSI that proved to speed up deployment of Linux systems across the enterprise and promoted the use of documentation to catalog the deployment of server functions for future automation. Advocated for the use of Industry Standards and Practices. Promoted the creation of Enterprise specific Standards and Practices in an effort promote stability and efficiency throughout the Infrastructure.
highlights: PXE boot RHEL/CentOS Build Automation.
Deployed Foreman ENC Puppet configuration management.
Deployed Katello Local RPM Repository
Automated the Linux patch management cycle.
Completed a Datacenter migration using Zerto.
Deployed an SVN code repo.
Designed a geographically diverse stratum 1 NTP deployment using ntpd and GPS.
Deployed Public & Private ROOT BIND9 nameservers (dns{1,2,3,4}.tnsi.com) with RNDC replication with hidden master and public slaves.

work.summary: Designed, Built and Maintained several enterprise environments including the MyNGC Enterprise Reverse Proxy, Enterprise Wiki, MyNGC SharePoint Portal, External PartnerConnect Microsoft TMG/UAG.
highlights: FIPS 140-2 compliant custom compiled Apache Reverse Proxies.
Deployed the enterprise MediaWiki with over 50,000 users and 200,000 articles for internal documentation.
Deployed "PartnerConnect" with Microsoft's Forefront Threat Management Gateway & Unified Access Gateway.
Deployed "myngc" Enterprise portal on Microsoft SharePoint Server.
